chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith Daniel Wilmot was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Keith Daniel Wilmot is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Keith Daniel Wilmot was found guilty of Attempt 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

records.addlTxt:
12:09 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Keith Daniel Wilmot in court.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court for Keith Daniel Wilmot. 
State calls Det. Sgt.  Robert Hebein/sworn/direct-witness IDs defendant. Cross by Svehlek.  Redirect Sowinski. 
Court finds probable cause exists and binds over.  Sowinski states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Svehlek willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. 
Bail continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
